result.execSummary:
The defendant Patricia M Beauprey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No consumption or possession of alcohol & no entering upon the premises of any bars or taverns.

Defendant must undergo an anger mangement session and follow through with any recommendations.

No contact with John Holsonback.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
Same conditions of probation as stated in count 1 with no additional community service hours.
Concurrent with: Count 1

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patricia M Beauprey

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Patricia M Beauprey in court with attorney Brent Harold DeBord.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 10:28 a.m. State - believes we are here for change of plea, will re-instate original settlement recommendation, defendant will plead g/nc to counts 1 & 2 as alleged, dimissed but read in count 3. Asks for 18 month probation, $300 fine plus costs on each count, AODA with follow thru, anger mangagement, no possesion or consumption of alcohol, no entry in bars or taverns, FT employment, 50 hours community service, no contact with JH or property owned by him. State has completed victim witness. Victim Impact Statement has been provided to the court and victim chooses not to be in court today. DeBord - makes statement regards to why they are now accepting the states offer and hopes the court accepts the joint recommendation. Court advises it is not bound by the state's settlement recommendation. Beauprey pleads Guitly to count 1 and count 2. Court dismisses but reads in count 3. Beauprey does not understand regarding charges that are read in. Attorney moves the court to withdraw.  Court denies motion of attorney withdrawing, court advises defendant of reading in a charge. Beauprey decides to proceed today. Court goes over plea questionaire and waiver of rights form with defendant, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intellegently entered her plea, waives her right to a jury trial, accepts plea and adjudges guilty. State makes final statement. DeBord makes final statement. Beauprey makes statement, remorseful. Court will accepts joint recommendation - Count 1: withold sentence and place on probation for 18 months with conditions of $300 fine plus costs, AODA with follow thru, anger management, no possesion or consumption of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns, FT employment/schooling with verbage, 50 hours of community service, no contact with JH. Ct. 2 - withold sentence and place on probation for 18 months concurrent to count 1 with same conditions, $300 fine plus costs and no additional hours of community service. Right to appeal.

Defendant Patricia M Beauprey in court with attorney Brent Harold DeBord.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:59 PM. State - not resolved - need JT date. DeBord agrees - has gone over Frye with the defendant. Court continues bond, sets for JT. Court will allow jurors to ask questions, MIL to be heard at 8:30 on JT date or if they are more significant, need to be filed 10 days prior to trial and a motion hearing can then be scheduled prior to JT date.  Jury trial scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
NBo contact with John Holsonback and no consumption of alcohol

Defendant Patricia M Beauprey in court with attorney Brent Harold DeBord.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:14 AM. DeBord has complaint, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts plea, enters NG plea. Court accepts pleas, set for FPT. State - bond - no contact with John Holsonback. Debord - no objections. Court - bond - $1000 signature bond, no contact with John Holsonback and no consumption of alcohol, refund bond to poster.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Bonded out prior to probable cause.
